iati-activity.title: Support to Building Institutional Capacities of the Electoral Management Bodies in the Romanian ODA priority countries
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of this project is to support the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and other key stakeholders involved in the electoral process (including elected political representatives, civil society and media representatives) in the partner countries of Romania’s official development assistance (ODA) programme in building their institutional capacities to organize independent, free and fair elections. The project will facilitate the exchange of experience in electoral assistance field between Romania (and for a number of selected activities Mexico) and the ODA partner countries through a number of seminars, work visits and electoral observation missions.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania
iati-activity.participating-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

location.name: MENA Region, Wider Black See Region, Iraq, Afghanistan, Palestine

iati-activity.title: Romanian Development Camp, 7th edition.
iati-activity.description: The Romanian Development Camp is an annual event initiated in 2008, which brings together representatives of all major Romanian stakeholders in the ODA field and international development practitioners in a 3-day training and experience sharing exercise. The purpose of this project is to contribute to strengthening the capacity of Romanian ODA stakeholders to design and implement ODA project and programmes.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Young people and their values
iati-activity.description: Aim: to provide alternatives to drug use for 20 young people from the Republic of Moldova Objectives: to expend the information degree and the involvement of the young people in the social life of the local communities to whom the young people belong as an alternative to the drug use.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: It’s your right to get involved
iati-activity.description: Aim: Active Involvement of the young people in interactive actions to promote the bases of active citizenship and respect of the youth rights. Objectives: to promote volunteering among young people as a type of involvement in the social life of the community. Exchanges of good practices and of experience between volunteers from Romanian and the Republic of Moldova
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Partnership for youth development
iati-activity.description: Aim: Development of a communication platform between the youth organization from Romania and Moldova concerning the public policies for youth. Objectives: To promote the exchange of good practices concerning the youth policies and the work with young people from Romania and the Republic of Moldova. To develop of the competences to create public policies for 70 young people in the frame of workshops. To create a social network of the competent young people from Romania and the Republic of Moldova in order to promote the promotion among the two states concerning public policies
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Communication and Knowledge
iati-activity.description: Aim: the project proposes a creative approach to the integration of the young people from Basarabia in Cluj Napoca and Bucharest based on the concept of assertive communication and learning based on experience. Objectives: to contribute to the integration of the students in the new university environment thru explication and raising awareness concerning the importance of the associative structures for them, the importance of their involvement in the extracurricular activities. To promote the democratic values. To promote the volunteering.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: European citizenship – active citizenship
iati-activity.description:
Aim: Train Romanian and Moldavian young people on rights, obligations and advantages of Romanian citizenship – European citizenship with a view to use the information in follow up civic initiatives and activities
Objectives: - Inform 80 young people on the role of citizen in the European society - Train 80 young Romanian and Moldavian people on rights, obligations and advantages of Romanian citizenship – European citizenship, during a 3 days training course - Support 80 young people in their professional and personal development through non-formal education.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Young people, today – entrepreneur, tomorrow
iati-activity.description: Aim: Fostering the non-formal creativity in the economic area of the young people’, to encourage their active and responsible assuming their role of promoters of both positive and sustainable changes at the level of their communities. Specific objectives: -to inform and educate a group of 50 young people in entrepreneurship issues and economic creativity by a non-formal training stage of 5 days, in order to form specific associative managerial skills (36h). - to organize a day trip in which participants will interact with the local community by using the information and skills acquired during the training stage to identify possible improving opportunities, to use them and implement the business (8h). - to realize, together with the participants, 4 methods of (self) evaluation regarding the business ideas, thus contributing to both their personal development and development of their community. - to create a positive attitude at about 2000 indirect beneficiaries regarding increased chances and better capacities with respect to the social and professional integration of the young people.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Active students involved in the life of community

iati-activity.title: EU Communication Campaign “Winning Hearts & Minds” in the Republic of Moldova
iati-activity.description: The general objectives and goal of the campaign promoting the European Union’s image in the Republic of Moldova are the following: (1) to stop the decreasing of support for European integration at 48-50%, according to the results of the BOP/IPP by November 2014; (2) to contribute to increasing of support for European integration among citizens of the Republic of Moldova, Gagauz ethnics, to at least 20% by the end of the year; (3) to contribute to increasing of support for European integration among citizens of the Republic of Moldova, Russian and Ukrainian ethnics to at least 20% and 35% by the end of the year.

iati-activity.title: Judicial training for BiH prosecutors and investigators
iati-activity.description: At the invitiative of the National Anticorruption Directorate a delegation of 8 prosecutors an investigators had a working meeting at ANI's headquarter with integrity inspectors part of the bilateral project US - Romania - Judicial training for BiH prosecutors and Investigators in order to study ANI's legislative and institutional framework.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Working visit from the Directorate on Corruption and Economic Crime
iati-activity.description: The National Integrity Agency hosted the working visit of the delegation from the Directorate on Corruption and Economic Crime (Botswana). The agenda of the visit included discussions with integrity inspectors related to various topics such as the legislative framework of the National Integrity Agency - its role, duties and prerogatives, inter-institutional cooperation aspects and practical cases, as well as best practices, and working visits to the National Anticorruption Directorate (DNA) and the General Anticorruption Directorate, that presented case studies specific to each institution.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Study visit of Tunisian magistrates
iati-activity.description: At the invitation of National Anticorruption Directorate a delegation of Tunisian magistrates paid a visit at ANI’s headquarters in order to exchange good practices on legal and institutional anti-corruption
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Study visit of experts from Republic of Moldova
iati-activity.description: At the initiative of the Romanian Center for European Policies in collaboration with the Center for Analysis and Prevention of Corruption of Republic of Moldova, a delegation of representatives of anti-corruption institutions of Moldova, have made a study visit at ANI’s headquarters to the premises of presenting the role of the Agency in the monitoring / evaluation of assets and interests disclosures as well as the procedures of assets verification and the cooperation between public authorities and civil society
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Study visit - Group of prosecutors and criminal prosecution officers from Republic of Moldova.
iati-activity.description: At the proposal of the National Anticorruption Directorate, in collaboration with the Bar Association Representation in the Republic of Moldova, a delegation of prosecutors, judges and investigation officers in combating corruption, made a study visit at A.N.I. headquarters, in order to exchange best practices regarding the investigation of the conflicts of interest, incompatibilities and unjustified wealth.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: The 3rd European Union – Republic of Moldova Forum
iati-activity.description: Following the Romanian Centre for European Policies’ invitation, a representative of the National Integrity Agency attended The 3rd European Union – Republic of Moldova Forum, held in Balti, Republic of Moldova. The event, organized by the Romanian Centre for European Policies together with the Association for External Policy and the Institute for Eastern Studies in Warsaw, and which brought together experts from Romania, Germany, Poland, as well as other EU member states, aimed to strengthen the Republic of Moldova’s European aspirations in the context of signing the EU Association Agreement.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: Training course of the members and the staff of the National Integrity Commission in the Republic of Moldova
iati-activity.description: At the invitation of the Representation in the Republic of Moldova of the American Bar Association (ABA ROLI), an expert of the National Integrity Agency attended, as a lecturer, the Training course of the members and the staff of the National Integrity Commission in the Republic of Moldova, on „The Typology of the Conflicts of Interest. Analysis of the Income and Property Declarations”, held in Chisinau. This initiative is part of the American Bar Association’s anti-corruption project, Rule of Law Initiative, which seeks to support the authorities’ effort in the fight against corruption in the Republic of Moldova
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

iati-activity.title: workshop on Strengthening Public Support for CNI Goals
iati-activity.description: At the invitation of the Romanian Center for European Policies (CRPE), in partnership with Center for Analysis and Prevention of Corruption in Moldova, an expert from ANI attended the workshop on Strengthening Public Support for CNI Goals, part of the Project “Building public support for anti-corruption efforts of the National Integrity Commission”, supported by the Embassy of Finland, held on Chisinau between May 12-13, 2014. ANI’s expert shared the experience of the Agency regarding interpretation and implementation of the legal framework, as well as best practices on fight against corruption
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania

transaction.aid-type: Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes
Core support to NGOs, other private bodies, PPPs and research institutes

iati-activity.title: Development, as a solution for reconciliation in the Transnistrian conflict
iati-activity.description:
Main objective: The project aims to contribute to reduce the disparities between the East and the West banks of the Dniester River in the Republic of Moldova by coordinating and harmonising the societies’ political, economic and social development level. Expected outcomes and outputs:
1. Data base with political and civil society representatives from the two regions of the Republic of Moldova available for dialog is created. The data base consists of experts representing political decision-makers and civil society organizations having relevant experience to analyse and indicate fractures, significant differences and similarities from socio-political, economic and non-governmental point of view.
2. The „Dialog în oglindă. Domeniile dezvoltării în perspective comparate la Chișinău și Tiraspol” Conference is organised and developed in Sibiu, Romania – the dialog involves experts in: political decision (present/ former political decision-makers from Kishinev and Tiraspol), economic development (economic analysts or private managers having companies with activity on both sides of the Dniester river), civil society development (NGOs representatives from Kishinev and Tiraspol, with programs and interest on both banks of Dniester river), the mass-media development framework and development directions (journalists / press analysts that follow the press phenomenon on both banks of the Dniester River), human rights (experts and leaders within organization working in the area)
3. Following the conference „Dialog în oglindă. Domeniile dezvoltării în perspective comparate la Chișinău și Tiraspol” it is drafted the Report with public policies proposal regarding reducing the development disparities within the Republic of Moldova society on the two sides of the Dniester river. First part of the report contains essential aspects from the experts presentations regarding the differences and the similarities in the political, economic, NGOs and mass-media fields between the two societies (East and West banks of Dniester river), but also the proposal for establishing a common set of values and political orientation as a result of debates. The second part contains public policies proposals (in politics, economics, NGO, mass-media, human rights) which, by their adoption by the political decision makers from Kishinev and Tiraspol would lead to a similar socio-political development on both sides of Dniester. The report will be translated in Romanian, Russian and English and printed in 500 copies, distributed within the Republic of Moldova society, in Kishinev and Tiraspol, also to the International organisations involved in managing the Transnistrian conflict (UN, OSCE, EU, European Council), to the state authorities in the countries with interests in the resolution of the conflict (Russia, Ukraine, EU countries, USA), the main NGO in Republic of Moldova, Romania, Russia, Ukraine and important countries in EU, the most important press agencies from Romania, Russia, Ukraine, EU countries, US, universities with research lines in geopolitics and external politics within the mentioned states.
4. Project visibility materials – project launching and closing events within the International Conference “Political Science, International Relations and Security Studies”(8th edition and respectively 9thedition), organized by “Lucian Blaga” University from Sibiu (2); press releases (3); scientific article, mass-media interviews (3 interviews of the implementation team members and two of Kishinev and Tiraspol experts), news published regularly on the Laboratory for the Transnistrian conflict analysis website.

iati-activity.title: “Post-conflict Reconstruction and Stabilisation" training programme
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the training program is to support post-conflict reconstruction and recovery efforts in the priority regions and countries of Romania’s international development cooperation policy. Specifically, the training will enable participants to understand and operate with specialised concepts and notions of post-conflict management; understand the specifics and mechanisms of coordination among various actors involved in post-conflict reconstruction and stabilisation; and analyse complex societal environments in post-conflict nations, and their impact in promoting good governance.

iati-activity.title: Black Sea NGO Forum, 7th Edition
iati-activity.description: The objective of the 7th edition of the Black Sea NGO Forum is to facilitate direct contact and the trasfer o knowledge and good practices among the civil society organisations in the wider Black Sea region and to raise Romania’s visibility in the region and within the European Union. The 7th edition of the Black Sea NGO Forum, “Enabling Environment for CSOs: Towards a Strategy of Civil Society in the Black Sea Region”, was organised in Kiev, Ukraine, between 8 and 10 December 2014. The Forum benefitted from the presence of over 140 participants, representatives of a wide range of national and international stakeholders from the Black Sea region – CSOs, regional and international organisations, regional and international donors, local authorities, academia, media.

iati-activity.title: Piloting a Child Protection Index
iati-activity.description: The objective of the project is to develop a simple evidence-based index of child protection reform efforts in the Republic of Moldova and in Georgia to raise awareness and action among governments, civil society and donors. The index will be a vital tool in advocating for the eradication of child poverty, child protection and accessibility to basic services. Once completed, the index framework will serve as a replicable model for other civil society actors across the wider Black Sea region.

iati-activity.title: Mobility Fund for Governmental Experts
iati-activity.description: The Mobility Fund is a pilot project, started in the autumn of 2013, that facilitates the quick transfer of Romanian experts and expertise to meet the ODA priority countries’ ad hoc needs in development sectors in which Romania can bring an added value, by sharing its transition experience to democracy and a market economy. This instrument is addressed to public servants from both Romania and its partner countries and gives special attention to the thematic priority areas of the Romanian ODA programme. The mobility fund is a tool for rapid reaction to address unforeseen development needs.

iati-activity.title: Conference and General Assembly Meeting of the Association of European Electoral Officials (ACEEEO)
iati-activity.description:
The 23rd Annual Conference and General Assembly Meeting of the Association of European Electoral Officials (ACEEEO) organized on 4-6 September, 2014 in Bucharest by the Permanent Electoral Authority The topic of the conference was 'Participation of Women in Electoral Process and Public Life' and 'Planning of a General Election’. PARTICIPATION OF WOMEN IN ELECTORAL PROCESS AND PUBLIC LIFE'
Although the suffrage of women has been recognized worldwide in the 20th century, and the most important international and regional human rights documents declare that right to vote, right to stand for the election and right to take part in public life should be ensured to women on equal terms, this group of the society face discrimination also in our days.
The main field of this discrimination is the taking part in the work of the Parliament and other directly elected representative bodies. According to the last published OSCE results, in the OSCE region the portion of women representatives in the lower chambers is 24,4%. However, more and more countries introduce legal means to increase legal participation in politics like for example quotas or similar rules. The first step for the development in this field is identifying discriminatory laws, policies and practices, and the 23rd Annual Conference of ACEEEO will give an opportunity for that as well as getting familiar with best practices.
Right to vote of women should also be ensured without discrimination and electoral management bodies play a crucial rule also in this field when preparing an electoral process, informing voters, organising trainings for the lower-level electoral management bodies and poll workers. Finally, it is also inevitable to have women in the electoral bodies and in other election-related organisations.
The above mentioned development can be conducted only with a strong cooperation among the law-making bodies, electoral management bodies, women rights non-governmental organisations, political parties and other electoral stakeholders.
II. 'PLANNING OF A GENERAL ELECTION’
General elections are certainly the most complex project that a state organ should implement in a country. In a relatively short period the electoral management bodies have to plan, operate and monitor plenty of different activities from the boundary delimitation, voter registration, establishing the polling committees, election training, voter education, registration of candidates, setting up the polling stations, ensuring the condition for a legal, safe casting of votes till the vote counting, results transmission and handling legal remedies.
During the whole process, legal, administrative, logistical, IT, financial and communicational tasks are conducted simultaneously. The basis for this is the accurate, careful and detailed planning.
What are the best methods for the planning? Can the usual means, approaches, definitions of general project management used also for this form of planning? How can IT operations support this planning process? Can workload be decreased by accurate planning? What are the main monitoring points and the best monitoring methods? How could main errors of the process be eliminated? Participants of the conference will be able to get an answer among others to these questions and contribute to the discussion with their own experiences.

iati-activity.title: Continuation of the public awareness campaign on development assistance and strengthening MFA's institutional capacity in the field of ODA
iati-activity.description: The general objective of the project is to support Romania in becoming an effective, innovative and increasingly influential actor for development cooperation so it can achieve sustainable, scalable development impact in the countries that are a priority of Romanian ODA. Specifically, the objectives of the project are: 1. to increase the visibility of Romania’s development assistance at both national and international level and consolidate Romania’s image of an emerging, active and innovative international donor; create understanding of the developing countries’ special challenges and needs in terms of development assistance and significance of Romania’s participation in international development cooperation; and increase acceptance and awareness of Romania’s development assistance provided to its strategic partner countries. 2. that, by 2015, the Government be fully capable and equipped with the appropriate capacity to manage all parts of ODA project management cycle by itself, including planning and design, programming, monitoring, evaluation and communications.

iati-activity.title: “How do we communicate to the public on the conflicts of interest and asset disclosure?”
iati-activity.description: At the invitation of the Romanian Center for European Policies and of the Analysis and Prevention of Corruption Centre in the Republic of Moldova, an A.N.I. expert attended the event on “How do we communicate to the public on the conflicts of interest and asset disclosure?” , held in Chisinau, the Republic of Moldova. Within the event dedicated to journalists and to representatives of the civil society from the Republic of Moldova, the Agency’s representative presented successful cases from A.N.I.’s activity, for facilitating a better understanding of the problem of the conflicts of interest and incompatibilities in Romania. The event was organized within the Project “Strengthening the public support for the anti-corruption efforts of the National Integrity Commission”, financed by the Embassy of Finland in Bucharest.

iati-activity.title: “Romania solidary with the world”
iati-activity.description: The objective of the project is to raise the awareness and understanding of the Romanian general public about the international development field and about Romania’s development cooperation policy, and to encourage people’s participation in projects and initiatives implemented by organizations active in the filed.
iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania
iati-activity.participating-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Romania
